text: Russian airstrikes on Syrian rebel
targets have raised the chances of an
international incident russia says it
has some 34 warplanes taking part in the
campaign turkey has complained about
Russian planes straying into its
airspace but the possible ramifications
go further Syrian fighter jets bombers
and helicopter gunships have been
targeting rebels since 2012 Israel has
launched airstrikes on suspected weapons
convoys for the Lebanese militia
Hezbollah who are allies of Syrian
President Bashar al-assad
and since the us-led coalition began
targeting Islamic state sites in Syria
in 2014 it has carried out more than
2,500 airstrikes several other countries
have also been involved in the air
campaign and so the air war over Syria
risks dangerous encounters escalation or
worse dreamy Smurf is the power
management tool which means turning your
phone on or off without you knowing even
if I've turned my phone off right and
then we've got nosy Smurf what's a nosy
swerve nosy Smurf is the the hot miking
tool so for example if it's in your
pocket they can turn the microphone on
and listen to everything that's going on
around you so who's bombing who in Syria
well Syrian President Bashar al-assad
is facing an armed uprising in his own
country he's been trying to crush it
with help from his friends Iran Russia
and Hezbollah from Lebanon
